name: Industrial
description: Emerged out of Punk and avant-garde art movements in the mid-1970s, often characterized by a bleak, mechanical atmosphere, the use of metallic percussion as well as other unconventional instruments, and extensive use of sampling influenced by Musique concrète.

children.name: Power Electronics
children.description: Waves of feedback, screeching analog synthesizers, and harsh, screamed vocals.

children.name: Death Industrial
children.description: Combines the abrasive textures of Noise and Industrial music with dark, brooding drones and atmospheres.

name: Noise
description: Strays away from conventional structure, tonality, and composition and consists predominantly of noise.

children.name: Ambient Noise Wall
children.description: Combines the static approach of Harsh Noise Wall with textures leaning towards Ambient music.

children.name: Black Noise
children.description: Incorporates unconventional sounds with overpowering or constant Noise and Black Metal elements, often being heavily texture-oriented, abrasive, dissonant, atonal, or repetitive.

children.name: Gorenoise
children.description: Combines and subverts Goregrind and Grindcore with brash Noise and even faster drum tempos.

children.name: Harsh Noise
children.description: Highly aggressive walls of sound that assault the listener.

children.name: Harsh Noise Wall
children.description: Harsh, distorted walls of sound that feature few dynamic variations and often take the form of long compositions with little to no change or progression over time.

children.name: Power Electronics
children.description: Waves of feedback, screeching analog synthesizers, and harsh, screamed vocals.

children.name: Death Industrial
children.description: Combines the abrasive textures of Noise and Industrial music with dark, brooding drones and atmospheres.

children.name: Power Noise
children.description: Combines looped samples of Noise with Electronic rhythms.

name: Post-Industrial
description: Umbrella group of genres that combine the dark, mechanical aesthetic of early Industrial music with more accessible genres, such as Rock and Electronic Dance Music.

children.name: Dark Ambient
children.description: Emphasizes an ominous, gloomy, and dissonant atmosphere.

children.name: Black Ambient
children.description: Incorporates elements such as guitars, synthesizers, harsh or whispered vocals, raw production, or other elements associated with Black Metal and Dungeon Synth.

children.name: Ritual Ambient
children.description: Dark, deep, disturbing, ritualistic, and occult atmosphere.

children.name: Deconstructed Club
children.description: Emerged in the 2010s as the hybridization of diverse Electronic Dance Music genres with an abrasive Post-Industrial sound.

children.name: EBM
children.description: Melodic and beat-driven Electronic Dance Music take on Post-Industrial that developed in the 1980s.

children.name: Dark Electro
children.description: Emerged in the early 1990s in Europe, combining EBM beats with the abrasiveness of old school Industrial but with a greater focus on a horror-inspired atmosphere and harsh, distorted vocals.

children.name: Aggrotech
children.description: Based on the dark atmosphere of Dark Electro, typically characterized by more aggressive Hardcore [EDM]-influenced beats and harsh/distorted vocals.

children.name: Futurepop
children.description: Derivative of EBM, retaining its apocalyptic worldview but incorporating heavy influence from the melodic style of Synthpop.

children.name: New Beat
children.description: Underground dance music which originated in Belgium around 1987, tending to resemble slower, harder EBM.

children.name: Electro-Industrial
children.description: Formed in the late 1980s and early 1990s; grew out of a combination of EBM and Industrial.

children.name: Dark Electro
children.description: Emerged in the early 1990s in Europe, combining EBM beats with the abrasiveness of old school Industrial but with a greater focus on a horror-inspired atmosphere and harsh, distorted vocals.

children.name: Aggrotech
children.description: Based on the dark atmosphere of Dark Electro, typically characterized by more aggressive Hardcore [EDM]-influenced beats and harsh/distorted vocals.

children.name: Epic Collage
children.description: Defined by its Deconstructed Club sonic palette and its cinematic proportions.

children.name: Industrial Hardcore
children.description: Fuses the sonic palettes and aesthetics of Industrial & Noise with the intense rhythms of Gabber, Speedcore, Doomcore and other subsequent styles.

children.name: Industrial Hip Hop
children.description: Incorporates harsh elements inspired by Industrial music such as blaring, noisy synths, distorted and metallic percussion, as well as more aggressive and off-kilter rapping styles.

children.name: Industrial Metal
children.description: Incorporates the abrasive and heavy sound from Industrial into a Metal context by using elements from Post-Industrial like synthesizers and drum machines.

children.name: Cyber Metal
children.description: Originated around 1999, influenced by EBM and Aggrotech with more melodic and less repetitive riffs as well as harsh vocals.

children.name: Neue Deutsche Härte
children.description: Alternative Metal and Industrial Metal that incorporates various aspects of electronic music, specifically Electronic Dance Music.

children.name: Industrial Rock
children.description: Incorporates abrasive guitars and synthesizers inspired by Industrial and various Post-Industrial styles.

children.name: Industrial Techno
children.description: Harder, darker style of Techno which draws parallels with factories and the rhythm of machinery.

children.name: Birmingham Sound
children.description: Cold, mechanical, and hypnotic tracks, typically lacking the harsher and noisier elements of later Industrial Techno.

children.name: Martial Industrial
children.description: Incorporates elements of traditional European military marches with Neoclassical Darkwave, Dark Ambient, Industrial, and Neofolk.

children.name: Power Noise
children.description: Combines looped samples of Noise with Electronic rhythms.
